Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell hit 59* and Devon Conway scored 52, helping New Zealand score 176/6
Finn Allen scored 35 off 22 in 4.1 overs
Washington Sundar took a spectacular one-handed return-catch diving full length
Mitchell Santner took a wicket first ball and a maiden in the powerplay
Deepak Hooda and Shivam Mavi gave India 10 wickets for 10 runs in overs 18 and 19
Santner sealed the game by taking a wicket in the 20th over
Pre-Game Insights: Spin was the way to go on the night, and New Zealand managed to score enough off India's fast bowlers
India didn't have the headstart of knowing it was turning
Captain Mitchell Santner displayed his guile and skill, taking a wicket first ball, bowling a maiden in the powerplay and then coming back to take Deepak Hooda in the 16th over
New Zealand got only 56 off the 10 overs bowled by the spinners, and managed 119 off the 10 overs of pace
Post-Match Reflections: Daryl Mitchell expressed pride in the team's resilience after the victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather or field conditions affecting the match: The sharply cut grass perhaps did the trick for New Zealand as the ball didn't quite become a bar of soap and kept gripping for their spinners
Notable head-to-head statistics: New Zealand won the first T20I of the series
